benchmark_details.name: FIRE (Feedback Integration and Refinement Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: FIRE is a feedback-refinement dataset consisting of 1.1M multi-turn conversations derived from 27 source datasets, empowering Vision Language Models (VLMs) to refine their responses based on user feedback across diverse tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of FIRE is to evaluate the feedback-refining capability of VLMs.

data.source: Derived from 27 diverse source datasets including public datasets.
data.annotation: Generated via simulations between student and teacher models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing the refined responses with ground truth answers using established text evaluation techniques.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with ground truth and higher quality feedback.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through human and automated assessments on various settings.
